<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GROCERY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/05/kroger-sees-record-trading-day-strong-earnings?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Kroger's a Grower not a Shower
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Kroger " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTcyOTg5NjI2LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Kroger, the largest supermarket chain in the U.S., had its <a href="https://www.ft.com/content/38ea98a6-ffe4-11e9-b7bc-f3fa4e77dd47?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">best trading day</a> in 26 years after nailing its investor day presentation yesterday.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The company gave bullish projections for sales growth and earnings for fiscal 2020. The cherry on top was a $1 billion share buyback plan to replace an existing, smaller one. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Kroger needed this</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">"Even though some things have not gone according to plan, we have made a series of smart financial and strategic moves and swallowed some difficult pills," CEO Rodney McMullen <a href="https://www.bizjournals.com/cincinnati/news/2019/11/05/kroger-updates-guidance-stock-jumps.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said</a>. Let's break that down.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">The plan: </strong></span><span>Just over two years ago, the company unveiled </span><span><a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/krogers-refresh-is-finally-paying-off-11572975768?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">a major initiative</a></span><span> it called "Restock Kroger," because MKGA and Yes We Tuna Can were already taken. Restock Kroger meant significant investments in revamped stores, tech, partnerships, and private label merch. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">The smart financial and strategic moves: </strong></span><span>Kroger inked partnerships with </span><span><a href="https://www.supermarketnews.com/retail-financial/kroger-walgreens-expand-retail-pilot?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Walgreens</a></span><span> and </span><span><a href="http://ir.kroger.com/file/Index?KeyFile=394833288&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Instacart</a></span><span> to reach more customers. It also </span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2018-05-23/kroger-beefs-up-amazon-response-with-200-million-meal-kit-deal?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">bought</a></span><span> the meal kit company Home Chef. Biggest of all was its investment in </span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/opinion/articles/2019-07-22/kroger-goes-full-robot-to-take-on-amazon-with-ocado?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Ocado</a></span><span>, a British online grocer known for its robot-dominated warehouses.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">The difficult pills:</strong></span><span> After spending so much to compete, Kroger shares were </span><span><a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/kroger-gets-marked-down-11551978444?mod=article_inline&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">knocked</a></span><span> hard in March, when it reported its biggest decline in gross margins since 2009. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Traditional supermarkets need to get creative </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Discount German grocers Aldi and Lidl are <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/aldi-lidl-cut-into-u-s-grocers-turf-11571140800?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">gobbling up</a> U.S. market share with pledges of $7.99 Rosé For All. <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/traffic-jam-in-aisle-three-whole-foods-is-crowded-with-shoppers-filling-online-orders-11572281343?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Digital disruption</a> is very real.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">And Amazon turned the industry upside down when it bought Whole Foods in 2017, though its grocery strategy since then has been a little <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/opinion/articles/2019-03-01/amazon-s-solution-to-its-grocery-mess-is-more-groceries?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">all over the place</a>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead…</strong>Kroger will lean into its <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/retail/stories/2019/09/06/kroger-launched-privatelabel-line-alternative-meat-products?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">private label offerings</a> to keep up the momentum. Its store brands accounted for almost 20%, or about $22 billion, of all sales in 2018.  </p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
INVESTING
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/05/robinhood-glitch-nets-users-millions?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Robinhood Didn’t Want an App for <em>That</em>
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Robinhood men in tights " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=363 src="http://giphygifs.s3.amazonaws.com/media/rkXNems5uxExG/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Robinhood men in tights " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="http://giphygifs.s3.amazonaws.com/media/rkXNems5uxExG/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">With a name like "infinite money cheat code," it's probably too good to be true. But some enterprising stock traders say they're using a backdoor to out-robinhood Robinhood, sometimes to the tune of millions, Bloomberg <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-11-05/robinhood-has-a-glitch-that-gives-traders-infinite-leverage?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reported</a> yesterday.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Now for some flashcards </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Robinhood: </strong>A $7.6 billion startup with a popular investment app that allows users to trade stocks sans fees. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Robinhood Gold</strong>: Its $5/month subscription that lets users trade with funds borrowed from the company.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Put options:</strong> When an owner has the right to sell an asset at a predetermined price by a set date. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">What happened</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">A backdoor in Robinhood Gold allowed users to tap an "infinite" amount of borrowed funds to purchase puts, with one user reportedly turning a $4,000 deposit into a $1 million position. Then, like any good netizen, they <a href="https://www.reddit.com/r/wallstreetbets/comments/drt5tr/guh_of_fame_2019/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">shared</a> how they did it on the Reddit forum r/wallstreetbets. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Robinhood hasn't <a href="https://techcrunch.com/2019/11/05/robinhood-has-a-glitch-thats-letting-users-borrow-far-more-than-they-should/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">disclosed</a> how many individuals took advantage of the glitch. Don’t get too excited because the traders could be required to return the money or be guilty of securities fraud, a Georgetown law professor told Bloomberg.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ENERGY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/05/chesapeake-energy-sounds-alarm-energy-industry?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
U.S. Shale May Be Past Its Peake
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Fracking " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTcyOTg4ODQ2LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Chesapeake Energy <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-11-05/chesapeake-cuts-2020-spending-view-by-30-amid-shale-slowdown?srnd=premium&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said</a> in a filing yesterday its possible inability to comply with a leverage ratio covenant "raises substantial doubt about our ability to continue as a going concern." </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Brewgle translate:</strong> It might be headed for bankruptcy. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The situation: </strong>A glut of U.S. shale production combined with consumers not taking enough road trips = low oil and gas prices. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>To get by, Chesapeake </span><span><a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/chesapeake-warns-on-risk-to-business-from-sagging-oil-prices-11572972005?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">has taken on</a></span><span> a heaping forkful of debt—over $9.1 billion as of Sept. 30, almost 4x its market valuation. It's also shifted focus away from natural gas toward crude oil, which it's more bullish on. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Markets took the hint. </strong>Chesapeake stock tanked nearly 18%, the most in three years. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>The U.S. shale boom is beginning to sound more like a thud. Chesapeake's slide is a bad sign since it was a pioneer in shale extraction. Across the industry, oil and gas companies are facing bankruptcy at the fastest rate in three years, according to Haynes and Boone LLP data cited by Bloomberg. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>Chesapeake plans to generate positive free cash flow in 2020, partly by reducing spending by almost a third.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">+ Because we know you're wondering: </strong><a href="https://corporatefinanceinstitute.com/resources/knowledge/finance/leverage-ratios/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">What is a leverage ratio</a>? </p>

</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/05/laxs-new-congestion-rules-need-ironing?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The Only Thing Worse Than Landing at LAX...
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Waiting in line at LAX " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTcyOTkyMTk4LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Al Seib/Los Angeles Times via Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">...we got nothing. Last week, Los Angeles International Airport <a href="https://www.vox.com/the-goods/2019/11/4/20944218/lax-airport-pickups-congested-mess?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">tried</a> tackling congestion in its arrivals deck by banishing ride-shares and taxis to a side lot. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But after being shuttled from their terminal to the "LAXit" pickup lot, passengers <a href="https://www.latimes.com/california/story/2019-10-29/uber-lyft-ban-lax-airport-pickup?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">queued up</a> with dozens (at one point over 100) antsy riders. Sunday evening, wait times <a href="https://twitter.com/VKadlubek/status/1191235634335117313?s=20&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">stretched</a> above an hour. And like dog years, airport minutes should be multiplied by seven.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Some good news: </strong>The airport said departure-level traffic improved 80%. And taxis got a rare bump as exasperated customers scrambled for anything with four wheels and AC.  </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Why did they do this?</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If you've never dealt with LAX traffic...imagine Penn Station at 6pm the day before Thanksgiving, but with cars. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>In 2018, the airport saw almost </span><span><a href="https://www.lawa.org/en/lawa-investor-relations/statistics-for-lax/10-year-summary/passengers?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">88 million</a></span><span> passengers—21 million more than in 2013. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>But curbside real estate hasn't increased, and ride-share companies have </span><span><a href="https://www.fehrandpeers.com/what-are-tncs-share-of-vmt/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">worsened</a></span><span> congestion. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Some <a href="https://la.curbed.com/2019/11/5/20948244/lax-it-uber-lyft-flyaway?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">argue</a> LAX is throwing spot treatments on deeper problems, and that the airport should move away from cars to shared transportation options. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>airport officials acknowledged they have kinks to work out and will expand the pickup lot.</p>

<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">

<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e865734bf6f7.jpg">

</a><span>  </span>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
DIGESTION
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/05/expensive-gold-toilet-display-shanghai?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
We Need More Training for This One
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="golden toilet " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTcyOTg2NDU5LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Han Haidan/China News Service/VCG via Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We haven’t been able to glean from reader surveys the percentage of you who are Bond villains...but if you are one, we have some bathroom decor advice. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">A solid gold toilet covered in 334.68 carats worth of diamonds is <a href="https://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-7651573/1million-Gold-toilet-bullet-proof-seat-40-000-diamonds.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">on display</a> at a trade fair in Shanghai. The price tag: $1,288,677. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">We know what you’re thinking…</strong>“Sounds great, but I bet it’s only encrusted in a measly 10,000 diamonds.” Wrong. There are 40,815. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The manufacturer, Coronet, is going for the Guinness World Record for “the most diamonds set in a toilet.” </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">We know what you’re </strong><strong style="color:#000"><em>really</em></strong><strong style="color:#000"> thinking…</strong>“What if 007 follows me into the bathroom with a revolver?” You’re good. The toilet's seat is <a href="https://nypost.com/2019/11/05/1-3m-toilet-golden-and-covered-in-diamonds-could-set-a-record/?utm_source=NYPTwitter&utm_campaign=SocialFlow&utm_medium=SocialFlow&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">bulletproof</a>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Unfortunately, it may not be for sale. The founder of Aaron Shum Jewelry, Coronet's owner, said, “We would like to build a diamond art museum so that more people can enjoy it.” </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Does that...mean what we think it means?</p>

</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Marvel Studios" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTcyOTk3NDIxLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Marvel Studios</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">If there’s one thing we ask Brew readers today...</strong>it <em>has </em>to be about the debate over Marvel movies. To recap: Legendary director Martin Scorsese said in an <a href="https://www.indiewire.com/2019/10/martin-scorsese-marvel-movies-not-cinema-theme-parks-1202178747/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">interview</a> last month that Marvel movies are “not cinema,” and clarified his comments in a <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/11/04/opinion/martin-scorsese-marvel.html?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=newsletter_axiosmediatrends&stream=top&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">NYT opinion column</a> Monday. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>“Many of the elements that define cinema as I know it are there in Marvel pictures. What’s not there is revelation, mystery, or genuine emotional danger. Nothing is at risk.”</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>“The pictures are made to satisfy a specific set of demands, and they are designed as variations on a finite number of themes.”</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">After hearing the initial interview, Disney CEO Bob Iger praised Scorsese but <a href="https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/disneys-bob-iger-martin-scorsese-hes-never-seen-a-marvel-film-1251958?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=newsletter_axiosmediatrends&stream=top&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said</a>, “I don’t think he’s ever seen a Marvel film.” </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">So now we throw it to you: </strong>Are Marvel movies “cinema”? <a href="https://twitter.com/MorningBrew/status/1191855423822979075?s=20&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Vote here</a>.</p>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</th>
</tr>
</table>

</div>

Restock Kroger meant significant investments in revamped stores, tech, partnerships, and private label merch. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe smart financial and strategic moves: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eKroger inked partnerships with \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.supermarketnews.com/retail-financial/kroger-walgreens-expand-retail-pilot?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eWalgreens\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e and \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"http://ir.kroger.com/file/Index?KeyFile=394833288\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eInstacart\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e to reach more customers. But some enterprising stock traders say they're using a backdoor to out-robinhood Robinhood, sometimes to the tune of millions, Bloomberg \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-11-05/robinhood-has-a-glitch-that-gives-traders-infinite-leverage?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereported\u003c/a\u003e yesterday.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eNow for some flashcards \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eRobinhood: \u003c/strong\u003eA $7.6 billion startup with a popular investment app that allows users to trade stocks sans fees. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eRobinhood Gold\u003c/strong\u003e: Its $5/month subscription that lets users trade with funds borrowed from the company.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003ePut options:\u003c/strong\u003e When an owner has the right to sell an asset at a predetermined price by a set date. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhat happened\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eA backdoor in Robinhood Gold allowed users to tap an \"infinite\" amount of borrowed funds to purchase puts, with one user reportedly turning a $4,000 deposit into a $1 million position. Then, like any good netizen, they \u003ca href=\"https://www.reddit.com/r/wallstreetbets/comments/drt5tr/guh_of_fame_2019/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eshared\u003c/a\u003e how they did it on the Reddit forum r/wallstreetbets. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eRobinhood hasn't \u003ca href=\"https://techcrunch.com/2019/11/05/robinhood-has-a-glitch-thats-letting-users-borrow-far-more-than-they-should/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edisclosed\u003c/a\u003e how many individuals took advantage of the glitch. Don’t get too excited because the traders could be required to return the money or be guilty of securities fraud, a Georgetown law professor told Bloomberg.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e...we got nothing. Last week, Los Angeles International Airport \u003ca href=\"https://www.vox.com/the-goods/2019/11/4/20944218/lax-airport-pickups-congested-mess?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etried\u003c/a\u003e tackling congestion in its arrivals deck by banishing ride-shares and taxis to a side lot. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut after being shuttled from their terminal to the \"LAXit\" pickup lot, passengers \u003ca href=\"https://www.latimes.com/california/story/2019-10-29/uber-lyft-ban-lax-airport-pickup?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003equeued up\u003c/a\u003e with dozens (at one point over 100) antsy riders. Sunday evening, wait times \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/VKadlubek/status/1191235634335117313?s=20\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003estretched\u003c/a\u003e above an hour. And like dog years, airport minutes should be multiplied by seven.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eSome good news: \u003c/strong\u003eThe airport said departure-level traffic improved 80%. And taxis got a rare bump as exasperated customers scrambled for anything with four wheels and AC.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhy did they do this?\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIf you've never dealt with LAX traffic...imagine Penn Station at 6pm the day before Thanksgiving, but with cars. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eIn 2018, the airport saw almost \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.lawa.org/en/lawa-investor-relations/statistics-for-lax/10-year-summary/passengers?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e88 million\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e passengers—21 million more than in 2013. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eBut curbside real estate hasn't increased, and ride-share companies have \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.fehrandpeers.com/what-are-tncs-share-of-vmt/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eworsened\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e congestion. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSome \u003ca href=\"https://la.curbed.com/2019/11/5/20948244/lax-it-uber-lyft-flyaway?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eargue\u003c/a\u003e LAX is throwing spot treatments on deeper problems, and that the airport should move away from cars to shared transportation options. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003eairport officials percentage of you who are Bond villains...but if you are one, we have some bathroom decor advice. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eA solid gold style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eon display\u003c/a\u003e at a trade fair in Shanghai. The price tag: $1,288,677. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWe know what you’re thinking…\u003c/strong\u003e“Sounds great, but I bet it’s only encrusted in a measly 10,000 diamonds.” Wrong. There are 40,815. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe manufacturer, Coronet, is going for the Guinness World Record for “the most diamonds set in a toilet.” \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWe know what you’re \u003c/strong\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e\u003cem\u003ereally\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e thinking…\u003c/strong\u003e“What if 007 follows me into the bathroom with a revolver?” You’re good. The toilet's seat is \u003ca href=\"https://nypost.com/2019/11/05/1-3m-toilet-golden-and-covered-in-diamonds-could-set-a-record/?utm_source=NYPTwitter\u0026utm_campaign=SocialFlow\u0026utm_medium=SocialFlow\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebulletproof\u003c/a\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eUnfortunately, it may not be for sale. The founder of Aaron Shum Jewelry, Coronet's owner, said, “We would like to build a diamond art museum so that more people can enjoy it.” \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTcyOTk3NDIxLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eMarvel Studios\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eIf there’s one thing we ask Brew readers today...\u003c/strong\u003eit \u003cem\u003ehas \u003c/em\u003eto be about the debate over Marvel movies. To recap: Legendary director Martin Scorsese said in an \u003ca href=\"https://www.indiewire.com/2019/10/martin-scorsese-marvel-movies-not-cinema-theme-parks-1202178747/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003einterview\u003c/a\u003e last month that Marvel movies are “not cinema,” and clarified his comments in a \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2019/11/04/opinion/martin-scorsese-marvel.html?utm_source=newsletter\u0026utm_medium=email\u0026utm_campaign=newsletter_axiosmediatrends\u0026stream=top\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eNYT opinion column\u003c/a\u003e Monday. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e“Many of the elements that define cinema as I know it are there in Marvel pictures. What’s not there is revelation, mystery, or genuine emotional danger. Nothing is at risk.”\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e“The pictures are made to satisfy a specific set of demands, and they are designed as variations on a finite number of themes.”\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAfter hearing the initial interview, Disney CEO Bob Iger praised Scorsese but \u003ca href=\"https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/disneys-bob-iger-martin-scorsese-hes-never-seen-a-marvel-film-1251958?utm_source=newsletter\u0026utm_medium=email\u0026utm_campaign=newsletter_axiosmediatrends\u0026stream=top\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esaid\u003c/a\u003e, “I don’t think he’s ever seen a Marvel film.” \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eSo now we throw it to you: \u003c/strong\u003eAre Marvel movies “cinema”? \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/MorningBrew/status/1191855423822979075?s=20\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eVote here\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c/th\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso]\u003e\u003c!
